sect2.title: Introduction to NAS
sect2.para: The Network Audio System is a network transparent, client/server audio transport system. It can be described as the audio equivalent of an X server.

sect2.title: Installation of NAS
sect2.para: Install NAS by running the following commands:

userinput.command: xmkmf && make Makefiles && make includes && make depend && make && make install install.man

sect2.title: Command explanations
sect2.para: xmkmf...: These commands use the standard for compiling X based applications.

sect4.title: Configuration Information
sect4.para: Create the NAS configuration file using the following command:
Edit the new configuration file to suit your network and system needs.
Install the /etc/rc.d/init.d/nas init script included in the package.
The init script uses a default parameter to allow access to all hosts on the network. Review the nasd man page for other available parameters if you need to modify the script.

sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The NAS package contains auconvert, auctl, audemo, audial, auedit, auinfo, aupanel, auplay, aurecord, auscope, autool, auwave, auphone, checkmail, nasd, issndfile, playbucket, soundtoh and the libaudio libraries.

sect3.title: au{utilities}
sect3.para: The au{utilities} are a collection of tools to convert, play, edit, record, and manipulate sound files. See the respective man page for each utility for a full description.

sect3.title: checkmail
sect3.para: checkmail plays a sound file when the user receives mail.

sect3.title: nasd
sect3.para: nasd is the Network Audio System server daemon.

sect3.title: issndfile
sect3.para: issndfile checks if a file is in a recognized audio file format.

sect3.title: playbucket
sect3.para: playbucket plays, or creates, the bucket corresponding to the specified file.

sect3.title: soundtoh
sect3.para: soundtoh converts a sound file to a C language header file.
